text:
This year we remembered the 30th anniversary of the fateful Oklahoma City Bombing. 

I was honored to join @OKCNM yesterday at Cheyenne High School to remind the next generation why this anniversary is so important, and why we can never forget the way our community came together in the aftermath of such tragedy.

One of the most pressing topics I hear from folks back home is the growing prevalence of fraud and financial threats to our families and institutions.
 
My home state alone lost over $75 million last year in fraud attacks. 
 
All of our federal agencies must prioritize effective prevention tools and work together to find and punish bad actors.

I discussed yesterday at @FinancialCmte ⬇️

Yesterday, my legislation to deter the CCP from invading Taiwan passed out of @FinancialCmte. 

The Chinese Communist Party poses an enormous economic, political, and national security threat to the United States. 

That’s why we must take the necessary steps to ensure Beijing would be subject to significant financial, diplomatic, and economic consequences should it threaten our allies in Taiwan. 

The PROTECT Taiwan Act will do exactly that⬇️
https://t.co/vjE6hMdVQa
https://t.co/wtVpd7PRLd

Great to have the Squaxin Island Tribe in Washington this week to discuss the FDPIR Act – legislation I introduced with @RepDavids that would allow tribes to self contract under USDA’s Food Distribution Program on Indian Reservations. https://t.co/0P16XAXbc0

This assistance is vital for producers in Oklahoma who are still recovering from the 2023 and 2024 wildfires.

Thank you for your continued leadership on this issue, @SecRollins!

It was an honor to take part in the 10th Annual Memorial Service for the recently passed former members of Congress.

I was joined by countless family members of the late Congressman Wes Watkins. It was a special moment to be able to share the impact Wes had not only on myself, but on millions of Oklahomans and Americans alike.

Thank you for hosting @usafmc!

24 years ago, when my staff and I saw the smoke rising from the Pentagon, we knew America was under attack. From that moment on, the nation was forever changed.

Each one of us carries that memory with us today – from the lives lost to the community heroes that banded together in the face of disaster.

We must never forget.

Political violence – from the evil attempt on President Trump last year to the horrific murder of Charlie Kirk today – is a cancer that plagues the very foundation of our great republic. 

Charlie was a force of nature in the conservative movement and wildly influential to millions of young Americans. Please join me in praying for his family and the future of our country.

From my time as @housescience Chairman to my time spent on the farm, I’ve seen firsthand that accurate and reliable weather forecasting is crucial for the day-to-day lives of Americans nationwide.

That is why reauthorizing the Weather Act is so important. 

Protecting American citizens and industries stands at the heart of President Trump’s America First agenda, so I look forward to seeing this bill reach his desk to be signed into law.

I’m glad to see the Fed make these necessary changes to the consensus statement. I’ve encouraged Chair Powell to revise the inflation targeting regime for years and I’m glad to see it done today.

I’ll continue to discuss the Fed’s framework review as Chair of the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity.

I am glad to see Eddie Fields chosen as the Oklahoma State Executive Director of the Farm Services Agency.

A lifelong public servant, Eddie spent a dedicated career in the Oklahoma State Legislature furthering our home state’s agriculture agenda. In this new role, he will carry on that legacy and continue to serve Oklahomans with dedication.
Oklahoma is home to so many fantastic rotary clubs! https://t.co/mujNui2R3v
Always a great time visiting with my neighbors at the Woodward Chamber of Commerce! https://t.co/2xzFfmwrZH

President Trump wants to cease production of the penny. Those of us in Congress are working to make that a reality.

It’s not just commonsense – it would save taxpayers millions. @RepLisaMcClain and I explain further in @dcexaminer⬇️
https://t.co/r5rSPo9A2R

When the news came that former Governor George Nigh had passed, I had to take a moment to reflect deeply on the life that he led. 

Whether as Lieutenant Governor or Governor of Oklahoma, he remained a steadfast fixture in mine and all of my fellow Oklahomans’ lives. We may have not always agreed on every political issue, but I always admired and respected him. 

Speaking with many of my friends and neighbors over the years, this sentiment is widely shared across our community. With this in mind, I only wish our modern world had more figures like George Nigh.

President Trump issued an executive order that prohibits the Treasury from minting more pennies. In Congress, we are working to codify this into permanent law. 

After losing $85 million from one-cent production last year alone, the time to stop this government waste is long overdue.

⬇️⬇️⬇️

As we continue to advance President Trump's effort to make America the "crypto capital of the world", I am glad to see my bill head to President Trump's desk to be signed into law.

The Securing Innovation in Financial Regulation Act – included in the CLARITY Act – codifies Lab CFTC and the SEC’s FinHub. This will bring needed regulatory clarity in the digital assets market to encourage innovation and stay competitive globally.

Both of these offices will make the Commissions more accessible to market participants and foster FinTech innovation.

Congratulations to Julie Callahan on her nomination as Chief Agricultural Negotiator. 

From my time on @HouseAgGOP and @HouseScience, I have seen Dr. Callahan's deep knowledge and experience of agriculture, science, and trade policy benefit farmers and ranchers.

I look forward to working with her and @USTradeRep to enact President Trump's trade agenda by lowering barriers for farmers to reach global markets.

Congratulations to OK-03's own and welcome to DC!

Looking forward to watching a Western Oklahoman on the biggest stage.

Thanks to @SecDuffy's leadership, the Academy in OKC is not only growing, but is the premier training facility for our Air Traffic Controllers.

Once again, this Administration's strong leadership is delivering results – and the safety of our skies is better off for it!

.@SecRollins is once again demonstrating her bold leadership in our effort to protect American agriculture.

A screwworm outbreak would be catastrophic for U.S. livestock herds. Ports of entry must remain closed until our southern neighbors make further progress to combat this threat.

Congratulations to Bryan Bedford on his Senate confirmation to be Administrator of the @FAA. 

With a proven track record in the aviation industry, Administrator Bedford is an excellent addition to the Trump Administration. 

I look forward to working with him, alongside @SecDuffy, to support @POTUS' vision of revitalizing our air traffic control system.

I agree. Farm security is national security. 

That’s why the House recently passed my bill to include the Secretary of Agriculture on CFIUS, the interagency committee tasked with reviewing foreign investments in the United States. 

With an increasing amount of potentially hostile foreign ownership of U.S. farmland, this effort is long overdue.

It’s time to get this bill signed into law and get @SecRollins on CFIUS!

Today marks 249 years since our Founding Fathers put pen to paper and forever changed the course of human history. 

The ideals set forth in our founding document would go on to have a profound impact not only on our nation, but the entire world. 

Today we remember their noble venture and celebrate American greatness!🇺🇸

With the One, Big, Beautiful Bill now heading to President Trump’s desk, it’s important to remember how we got here. 

Over the last four years, America was headed in the wrong direction – from unchecked taxpayer spending to unmitigated illegal immigration. 

This historic legislation addresses these crises by fulfilling critical campaign promises: it secures the border, cuts spending, lowers taxes, and roots out waste, fraud, and abuse. 

While the legislative process is rarely smooth, this bill will deliver real results to Oklahomans and the American people.

At today’s NATO summit, @POTUS displayed to the world America’s renewed and rightful place as the dominant global superpower.

He delivered peace to a region plagued by conflict, leant needed support to our friends in Israel, and instilled fear in our adversaries.

I thank President Trump for his continued legacy of peacebuilding and for reinforcing that peace through strength is a necessary component of American foreign policy.

On @SquawkCNBC this morning, @RepFrenchHIll hit the nail on the head when asked about the current health of the Treasury market.

Our Task Force was created to ensure the Treasury markets remain the deepest, most liquid, and most resilient in the world.

We will continue to do exactly that on the Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity Task Force✅
https://t.co/KDgZJkrr81
https://t.co/Vm3J6ZZ7C7

I applaud the Fed for finally proposing to modify the eSLR — an action I’ve been encouraging on @FinancialCmte for years.

I will continue to advocate for Treasuries and reserves to be excluded from the ratios to increase liquidity in the Treasury market.

As Chair of the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity, I have made it clear that we should not disincentivize holding near risk-free assets.

I held hearings in April and May on this exact topic🧵

As we mark the anniversary of Roe v. Wade’s rightful overturning today, we must hold fast to the notion that all life ought to be protected. 

Those of us in Oklahoma have consistently made that abundantly clear and we will continue to lead the way in this just and righteous effort.

In a recent letter, I encouraged Chair Powell to do this with a number of my colleagues on the Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity Task Force.
https://t.co/5vZseQSnoq

I’ve long advocated for needed reform to the SLR and eSLR. 

Glad to have Federal Reserve Chair Powell before @FinancialCmte today to continue the conversation. 

I look forward to reviewing tomorrow’s proposal. https://t.co/qG1Uuj5vcL

I explain why this effort is so important in my Op-Ed with @agripulse⬇️
https://t.co/5oWQqxj4SE

According to a @USDA report, the CCP owns 349,442 acres of American farmland. 

As a fifth-generation farmer and rancher, who's seen this issue grow in concern, it’s clear that protecting America's agriculture industry is paramount to our national security. 

That's why I’ve spent years working on legislation to permanently include the Secretary of Agriculture as a member of CFIUS, the interagency committee charged with reviewing the national security implications of foreign investments. 

Today that legislation passed the House. I’d like to thank my colleagues for bringing this longstanding priority of mine one step closer to becoming permanent law.

I commend @SecRollins on this effort.

This is a tremendous step in the right direction – something @RepTonyGonzales and I discuss in our recent Op-Ed👉https://t.co/75seVIh81h

This is exactly why I have long advocated to give the Secretary of Agriculture a seat at the table during national security discussions.

My bipartisan bill would do exactly that. Read more about it in my Op-ed👉https://t.co/5oWQqxj4SE

"While it might not be as captivating a story, the USDA’s suspension of animal imports along our southern border was a bold, resolute, and necessary decision. But how did it come to be, and why was it ultimately done?"

Read my Op-ed with @RepTonyGonzales in @agripulse to find out more about the Screwworm's long history in the U.S. and what is being done to prevent it from ever returning⬇️
https://t.co/AGhu825uji
Great to be with @POTUS and my colleagues in House Leadership yesterday to discuss our joint effort to deliver for American families🇺🇸 https://t.co/8T1uEySd4w

Oklahoma is a leader in the aviation industry, so I have a particular interest in exploring any opportunity to improve our outdated systems. @SecDuffy and @FAA_Chris also share our focus on the modernization of the National Airspace System.

That is why I am so glad to work with @RepMillsPress on such a proactive and prudent piece of legislation. 

More below on how this bill is a critical step in the right direction⬇️ 
https://t.co/5tbY2rsOiR

81 years ago, Allied troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in one of the most bold and decisive military operations the world has ever known. 

As we look back in hindsight, success was not a guarantee. For that, we must never forget the bravery displayed on those beaches in the shared defense of freedom.

Great to have my friend and fellow Oklahoman Dr. Sebert at @HouseAgGOP today. 

As the former Executive Director for over 20 years at the National Watershed Coalition, Dr. Sebert knows well the importance of the Watershed and Flood Prevention Program at USDA.

We both agree: it's time to pass President Trump's Big, Beautiful Bill and the next Farm Bill so we can further expand these voluntary conservation practices.

Read more about today's hearing below⬇️
https://t.co/lQmvK10m6i

It’s been 90 years since the Dust Bowl plagued my home state of Oklahoma.

That’s why at today’s @HouseAgGOP Conservation Subcommittee hearing, we discussed the need to build on voluntary conservation practices by passing President Trump’s Big, Beautiful Bill and the next Farm Bill.

I’m pleased to see Miki Bowman confirmed as the Vice Chair for Supervision of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors. 

Her confirmation represents a dramatic shift in prudential regulation at the Fed as she understands the need to tailor regulation to the size and risk profile of our banks. 

I am looking forward to continuing to work together as I chair the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity.

This is welcome news for livestock producers affected by the drought and wildfires in 2023 and 2024. 

Thank you to @SecRollins for acting quickly and delivering much-needed emergency relief payments ahead of schedule. This timely support will help ranchers recover and keep our livestock industry strong. 

More below⬇️
https://t.co/y8wbBcW9be
Congratulations to my alma mater on this exceptional accomplishment and historic achievement! #GoPokes

Great speaking with @agritalk to provide an update on where the Farm Bill currently stands in Congress!
https://t.co/yT77wlnhlq

Passing the House Republicans' reconciliation package was not just a follow through on our promise to advance President Trump's agenda, it was also necessary for Oklahoma.

Included in this bill are key provisions that our cherished agriculture industry depends on, such as expanding the farm safety net and investing in critical programs. This historic piece of legislation also secures vital funding for the FAA Academy in OKC and prevents a disastrous tax hike on Oklahomans.

Failing to pass this bill would have been negligent for Oklahoma and for the entire country.

This morning, Oklahoma’s very own Jimmy Emmons was sworn in to serve at the @USDA Natural Resources Conservation Service.

As a lifelong Oklahoman, Jimmy has spent years working around the state and across the country promoting innovative and voluntary conservation practices. Having someone like this in a position to lead farm policy isn’t just beneficial for Oklahoma, but the entire country and the world. 

I am proud of my longtime friend and fellow Oklahoman for his willingness to serve the nation and his commitment to the American farmer.

We've seen in recent years that our Treasury market deserves closer attention.

It is no surprise then that all of our witnesses agreed today: we can improve the Treasury market's structure in order to bolster its health and resilience as the foundation of the global economy.

I enjoyed continuing our Task Force's work to examine this and much more.

More below⬇️
https://t.co/cxvolMCHmg

A prudent and necessary decision. 

When screwworm last appeared in the US, the eradication effort took decades. 

It is our job to ensure that work was not done in vain, so I commend @SecRollins for this resolute and decisive decision.

I spoke at @HouseAgGOP yesterday about reducing barriers for clearing services in the Treasury market.

Looking forward to discussing this further with @SecScottBessent at today’s @FinancialCmte hearing. https://t.co/ccLU7w3BxW

Thank you @SecDuffy. 

Looking forward to continuing our work to supercharge the Academy!

I applaud @SecDuffy and President Trump for their continued leadership and investment in our nation’s controllers.

Supercharging the Air Traffic Controller hiring pipeline is something I’ve long advocated for and I look forward to working with the Administration in growing the ATC workforce.
https://t.co/5eLCcL6wSU

Great spending time with the @okcchamber today in Washington.

We were able to discuss a number of issues, including my work to protect the Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center in OKC.

Always a pleasure to meet with them! https://t.co/qz2f8fAbbC

Looking forward to joining @Eleanor_Mueller momentarily to discuss my work on @FinancialCmte and the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, end Economic Prosperity.

Tune in below⬇️

Each year we remember the 168 lives lost in a senseless act of terror. 

For many of us, the wounds of that day still carry a heavy burden. However, we must never forget how the inhumanity of one brought out the collective humanity of countless others as Oklahomans came together to overcome unthinkable tragedy. 

I am constantly filled with hope every time I’m reminded of the overwhelming sense of community that we witnessed 30 years ago. May this memory help shape a better future for us all.

Today marks 90 years since Black Sunday, a day that changed our state forever. 

I wrote an Op-Ed in @TheOklahoman_ to not only remember that fateful day, but also reflect on the progress made in Washington to avoid the policy mistakes that led to that such a tragedy. 

Read below👇

This week, I had the privilege to honor the late Wes Watkins on the House Floor. 

Oklahomans will remember Wes as a dedicated public servant who fought hard to bring abundant opportunities and prosperity to his neighbors. 

Watch⬇️ https://t.co/FVUeRMebFY

Congratulations to @SECGov chair Paul Atkins for his confirmation vote tonight. 

I look forward to working with him to rightsize regulations in our markets. Let’s get to work!

The federal government should never be in the business of creating “one-size-fits-all” approaches to financial products. 

As one of many such examples, the CFPB’s misguided overdraft rule would implement harmful price controls over our banks and credit unions. Put simply, it’s an erroneous effort that harms consumers’ access to financial flexibility and emergency liquidity. 

The American economy is better off with it overturned.

I’ve been reminding my colleagues this week:

We need to pass our budget resolution so we can start working on important issues, like addressing the national debt and reauthorizing the Trump Tax Cuts before they expire. 

It’s time to focus! https://t.co/OOPTUtb91n

This is too important of an issue to ignore. 

That’s why I look forward to continuing our work on the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity.

And at several @FinancialCmte hearings, former Treasury Secretary Yellen agreed that we need urgent reform to increase participation in U.S. Treasury markets.
https://t.co/Surgc0eGZf

Also last month, my @FinancialCmte colleagues and I sent a letter to Fed Chair Powell urging him to solicit stakeholder feedback on the SLR.
https://t.co/5vZseQSnoq

We also touched on the need for this at the first Task Force hearing last month.
https://t.co/soblPWMP58

At yesterday's Task Force hearing on the Treasury market, we discussed the need to reform the supplementary leverage ratio (SLR) and enhanced supplementary leverage ratio (eSLR).
https://t.co/Vm3J6ZYzMz

I’ve been around long enough to remember the disruptions after 9/11, the 2008 housing crisis, and more recently COVID.

Put simply, we have to be prepared for the unexpected. That's why we have to engage in meaningful discussions about Treasury market structure and reform.

This is an issue I’ve raised at @FinancialCmte for years with various Treasury secretaries and Fed chairs🧵

I can’t think of a more important time in world economic history to be discussing Treasury debt.

We’ll be doing exactly that at today’s Task Force hearing. 

Tune in at 2pm ET🔜 https://t.co/Z51m8QL0Z0 https://t.co/AQqniEsQFN

It remains abundantly clear that keeping our skies safe is a paramount priority for @SecDuffy and the Trump administration. 

That's why I introduced the AERO Act, which will ensure the Air Traffic Controller Academy in OKC remains open in the case of a government shutdown.

The Academy serves a fundamental role in the overall safety of the aviation industry. We must protect it at all costs.
https://t.co/KsnZtFddQH

Burdensome reporting requirements imposed on our financial institutions take resources away from their mission: serving customers. 

We discussed today at @FinancialCmte⬇️ https://t.co/2RpK5H8UTR

I look forward to joining @FedSoc tomorrow to discuss my work as Chair of the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity.

Be sure to register below⬇️
https://t.co/FWCSAXONWC

I join Oklahomans everywhere in mourning the loss of a great statesman and dedicated civil servant, Wes Watkins. 

As the Congressman for Oklahoma’s Third District, he strived to better the community we all know and love. 

Coming from the humblest of beginnings, Wes, through sheer determination and the strongest work ethic, rose to become a member of the US House Appropriations Committee and later the Ways & Means Committee. A feat that will never be duplicated again! 

Lynda and I are praying for his family.
Thank you, @SecDuffy! Let’s get to work!
It's always a pleasure to spend time with my neighbors in Western Oklahoma and discuss the issues of the day! https://t.co/MMCvobgisg

Glad to see this crucial funding reach the hardworking Oklahomans that keep our food on the table.

I commend @SecRollins for working alongside us on @HouseAgGOP to ensure our farmers and ranchers receive the assistance they need in a timely fashion.

It’s #NationalAgDay!

It is an honor to represent so many farmers and ranchers in Western Oklahoma. They keep food on the table for Oklahomans, Americans, and millions around the world.

Be sure to thank a farmer today! https://t.co/kCmDyMPqM9

I’m pleased to see Miki Bowman nominated as Vice Chair for Supervision of the Federal Reserve Board of Governors. @FinancialCmte has made it clear that filling this role is essential for meaningful regulatory review at the Federal Reserve. 

Miki Bowman understands the importance of tailoring for community banks, and as a Kansan she knows well the needs of capital intensive industries like Agriculture and Energy. I am looking forward to beginning our work together in her new role.

If you are interested in participating in the 2025 Congressional Art Competition, the application window is now open!

Each year, our office works with local high schools to recognize and encourage artistic talent in our community. The winning artist will receive free airfare for two to participate in the Congressional Art Competition’s ribbon-cutting ceremony this summer and will have their winning piece hang in the U.S. Capitol for a year.

Don't miss the opportunity to participate in this year's competition – the deadline is fast approaching! To learn more about eligibility and how to apply, click on the link below⬇️
https://t.co/SAY6wTA8FB

I sent a letter to Fed Chair Powell today urging him to finally adjust the supplementary leverage ratio in order to improve liquidity in the Treasury market.

Chair Powell agrees — it’s past time to change the SLR.
https://t.co/5vZseQSnoq

We’ve seen the way partisan politics creeps into supervision of our financial systems. 

As Chairman of the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity, I’ve spent a lot of time talking about the Federal Reserve system becoming more and more partisan.

 We discussed in yesterday's @FinancialCmte hearing⬇️
Always great to have the @okcchamber in DC to discuss what's going on in Washington and back in Oklahoma. https://t.co/p790yZAc2p

I’d like to thank my @FinancialCmte colleagues for passing my bill, the Agricultural Risk Review Act, out of committee today. 

As a fifth generation farmer and rancher, I know firsthand that food security is national security. That's why I've long advocated for this bill to give the Secretary of Ag a voice in national security discussions.

It’s time to make this law permanent.
I’ve long pointed out the bottlenecks in the FAA’s ATC hiring process. I’m thankful to @POTUS and @SecDuffy for bringing much needed action to address this problem.

At today’s Task Force hearing, we had the opportunity to discuss a number of monetary policy issues that have real impacts on Americans. 

One issue in particular was the Fed’s calculation of the supplementary leverage ratio. We agreed that given the stress on the Treasury market, it may be time for the Fed to reevaluate the SLR. 

Watch below⬇️

This morning at @FinancialCmte, we will hold the first hearing from the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity.

We’ll be taking a look at how the Fed controls the money supply and interest rates – and why it matters to every American.

Tune in below⬇️
https://t.co/J62vETQcV6

I commend @SecRollins for taking quick action to ensure producers receive this crucial aid in the coming weeks.
https://t.co/c1m4Iqr4J8

I applaud the SEC’s decision to extend the compliance deadlines for the Treasury Clearing Rule. 

I recently sent a letter with my @FinancialCmte colleagues urging the SEC to do just that.

Looking forward to discussing this and much more through the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience and Economic Prosperity✅
https://t.co/LKQVV5M9Ub

On March 4th, the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity will hold its first hearing. 

More below⬇️

Great to have physicians of different specialties from the Oklahoma State Medical Association in town this week! 

I enjoyed engaging in a productive discussion about supporting our physicians back home, especially those in rural areas. https://t.co/G8GYH6pTdU

Today at @FinancialCmte we have the opportunity to question Fed Chair Powell about the state of the economy. 

As Chair of the Task Force on Monetary Policy, Treasury Market Resilience, and Economic Prosperity, we have an opportunity to dive deeper into the issues that deserve our attention.
https://t.co/XFrUv6gUat

After hearing from a group of witnesses that represent a cross section of the Farm Economy, it remains abundantly clear that rising input prices continue to plague farmers and ranchers across the country. 

Today's @HouseAgGOP hearing only emphasizes the urgent need to pass a Farm Bill this Congress. I am grateful to have a Chairman that shares this sentiment and is committed to doing exactly that.

Holocaust Remembrance Day serves as a painful reminder of the past so that we may be ever vigilant in the future – especially as the Jewish people continue to face persecution today.

#HolocaustRemembranceDay https://t.co/NMB6D70JJA

I'm encouraged that one of our first legislative actions in the new Republican majority was passing the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. 

In doing so, we reaffirmed our commitment to standing up for the right to life of all Americans – born and unborn.
Looking forward to leading this task force⬇️ https://t.co/9D29KGxUMK
Honored  to be chosen by Chairman Hill to lead this important Task Force.

I appreciate Vice Chair Barr’s commitment to public service. 

I look forward to working with President Trump’s selection of a successor.

I join the State of Oklahoma in mourning the loss of Gene Rainbolt. Gene embodied the values of Oklahoma with his entrepreneurial spirit, dedication to serving his community, and devotion to his family. Lynda and I join those honoring his enduring legacy.
https://t.co/cgbLYAbPBO
https://t.co/8gwLjmbWfq

Congratulations to Stillwater natives Joshua, Benjamin, and Jiaze for winning @CongressionalAC, which is the most prestigious prize in student computer science.

Their app – StudyMaster – is designed to help fellow students study more effectively. Learn more about the app below!

I am heartbroken to hear of the horrific attack in New Orleans early this morning. 

Please join me in praying for the victims of this tragedy and the law enforcement tasked with bringing us needed clarity in this dark hour.
My statement on the passing of former President Jimmy Carter. https://t.co/rwB85qA5j0

I hope everyone in Oklahoma and around the world enjoys a Merry Christmas!

I am especially blessed to call Oklahoma my home, and like always, I remain forever grateful for the incredible people that make this state so special. https://t.co/JxapMFc9DL

Greater transparency in the Fed’s stress test models will improve financial stability and result in better economic outcomes. 

Looking forward to providing feedback.
Today’s vote provides economic assistance to American farmers and communities impacted by severe weather, extends the Farm Bill’s authorities, and keeps the government open.
Extending government funding into early next year and the Farm Bill till September of 2025 allows Republicans and @realDonaldTrump to get to work on delivering results for the American people.

I was lucky enough to work closely with Dr. Moore over the years in Oklahoma and as Chairman of @housescience. 

While it is a tremendously sad day for our state and country, I am confident his legacy will have a lasting impact for generations to come.

As the Director of the National Weather Center in Norman, Dr. Moore’s influence made Oklahoma the weather forecasting capital of the country. 

His impact was also felt around the globe, as he was a lead author for an intergovernmental report that won the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize.
I join Oklahomans everywhere in mourning the loss of Dr. Berrien Moore, a devoted international scientist and longtime public servant🧵 (1/3)

Happy 388th birthday to the oldest military organization in the US, the @USNationalGuard

Oklahoma is home to nearly 9,000 Guard members. Like the National Guard has been for centuries, these men and women are always ready, and alway there! https://t.co/Kj21EKNsWJ
https://t.co/qeRQfpalbA

In 1941, more than 4,000 Americans lost their lives on this day that will forever live in infamy.

The USS Oklahoma – whose aft wheel was recovered and is now held in the Oklahoma History Center – fatefully sank. 

The next day, the U.S. entered WWII. May we never forget 12/7! https://t.co/EUwIb6rvGA

I hope everyone in Oklahoma and across the country enjoys a happy Thanksgiving!
 
I am especially blessed to call Oklahoma my home, and like always, I remain forever grateful for the incredible people that make this state so special! https://t.co/pV0vGmrwfT

I also led a letter urging the FDIC to withdraw its proposal.

Read more below👇
https://t.co/pKCM4jT5TH

The FDIC’s proposed board governance rule would undermine sound risk management practices and introduce massive risk into the banking system.

I pressed the need to withdraw this rule with Chair Gruenberg at today’s @FinancialCmte hearing.

Watch below⬇️ https://t.co/0lCmEVlBan

117 years ago today, President Roosevelt issued a Proclamation making Oklahoma the 46th state of our great Union. 

For five generations, my family has been blessed to call this state our home. 

Just like my friends and neighbors, I will always work hard to better our community! https://t.co/3uNQOHOqlj

I was honored to receive the @okfarmbureau Distinguished Service award over the weekend at their 83rd annual meeting!

The Farm Bureau is like family to me, and when family pays you this kind of compliment, it certainly means more.

Looking forward to our continued work together! https://t.co/mcUw5LquGd

Great to be with my friends in Woodward last week to speak at the @OSBI_OK Citizen Academy.

OSBI has a rich history in our state since being founded in 1925, but the “citizen academy” gives community members the opportunity to be a part of its mission.

Thank you for having me! https://t.co/FEQdQKYRbl

Happy Veterans Day!🇺🇸

In 1918, on the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month, World War I officially ended.

Since 1954, we have celebrated Veterans Day every year on November 11th to coincide with this great occasion and honor millions of selfless heroes in this country.

Congratulations to President Trump and my Congressional colleagues on remarkable victories!
